logtoolkit package#

Module contents#

A toolkit let you set up logging easier.

class logtoolkit.ColorfulFormatter(colors: dict[Literal['DEBUG', 'INFO', 'WARNING', 'ERROR', 'CRITICAL'], Literal['BLACK', 'RED', 'GREEN', 'YELLOW', 'BLUE', 'MAGENTA', 'CYAN', 'WHITE', 'BRIGHT_BLACK', 'BRIGHT_RED', 'BRIGHT_GREEN', 'BRIGHT_YELLOW', 'BRIGHT_BLUE', 'BRIGHT_MAGENTA', 'BRIGHT_CYAN', 'BRIGHT_WHITE']], fmt: str | None = None, datefmt: str | None = None, style: Literal['%', '{', '$'] = '%', validate: bool = True, *, defaults: Mapping[str, Any] | None = None)#

Bases: Formatter

Custom formatter to color your logger.

Usage:

>>> cfmt = ColorfulFormatter(
        colors={
            'DEBUG': 'CYAN',
            'WARNING': 'YELLOW',
            'ERROR': 'RED',
            'CRITICAL': 'BRIGHT_RED'
        },
        fmt='[%(levelname)-5s %(asctime)s]: %(message)s',
        datefmt='%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S',
    )
>>> handler = StreamHandler()
>>> handler.setFormatter(cfmt)

Constructor method.

The colors parameter SHOULD be as follow:

{
    'DEBUG': 'CYAN',
    'WARNING': 'YELLOW',
    'ERROR': 'RED',
    'CRITICAL': 'BRIGHT_RED'
}
The key of colors MUST be log level in capitalize string, basically:

DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL

The value of colors MUST be one of the color, see logtoolkit.types.ColorName.

About other parameters:

See logging.Formatter documentation for more information.

Parameters:

  • colors (dict[LogLevel, ColorName]) – Key-value pair of the color to use for each level.

  • fmt (str|None) – The format to use in formatter.

  • datefmt (str|None) – The date format to use in formatter.

  • style (FormatStyle) – The style parameter use for formatting.

  • validate (bool) – Valid the input format or not.

  • defaults (Mapping[str, Any]) – Assign extra parameter to fmt.

format(record: LogRecord) → str#

Format the specified record as text.

The record’s attribute dictionary is used as the operand to a string formatting operation which yields the returned string. Before formatting the dictionary, a couple of preparatory steps are carried out. The message attribute of the record is computed using LogRecord.getMessage(). If the formatting string uses the time (as determined by a call to usesTime(), formatTime() is called to format the event time. If there is exception information, it is formatted using formatException() and appended to the message.

logtoolkit.getLogger(name: str | None = None) → Logger#

Wrapper of logging.getLogger().

Parameters:

target (Optional[str]) – Name of the logger

Returns:

Requested logger.

Return type:

logging.Logger

logtoolkit.quickConfig(name: str, formatter: Literal['CLEAN', 'XML', 'COLOR'], stream_handler: Literal['stdout', 'stderr'] | None = None, file_handlers: dict[Literal['log_file', 'error_log'], str] = {}) → Logger#

Configure logger using templates. This function also return the logger with specified name.

About formatters:

The formatter parameter MUST be one of the FormattersModels, see follows:

CLEAN:

Format your log as [INFO    1900-01-01 00:00:00]: foo.

XML:

Format your log as 1900-01-01T00:00:00:INFO: foo.

COLOR:

Same as CLEAN, but colored. Only use for console output.

Will switch to CLEAN formatter automatically when using FileHandlers.

About handlers:

The stream_handler parameter SHOULD be one of the StreamHandlersModels, Will not create any if not specified.

stdout:

Create a StreamHandler with stdout, Loglevel will be set to DEBUG.

stderr:

Create a StreamHandler with stderr, Loglevel will be set to ERROR.

The file_handlers parameter SHOULD be one of the FileHandlersModels, Also won’t create any if not specified.

log_file:

Create a FileHandler for log file, Loglevel will be set to INFO, Create a new log file everyday and keep for 1*30 days.

error_log:

Create a FileHandler for error log, Loglevel will be set to ERROR, Create a new error log file every 30 days and keep for 30*12 days.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Name to use for the logger.

  • formatter (FormattersModels) – Formatter to use for the logger.

  • stream_handlers (StreamHandlersModels|None) – Name of StreamHandler to use for the logger.

  • file_handlers (dict[FileHandlersModels, str]) – Name-Path pair of FileHandlers to use for the logger.

Returns:

Configured logger.

Return type:

logging.Logger

logtoolkit.yamlConfig(path: str) → None#

Read and configure logging from a YAML file.

Parameters:

path (str) – Path of the YAML file.

Submodules#

logtoolkit.models module#

This module contains Configured models of Formatters and Handlers.

class logtoolkit.models.Formatters#

Bases: object

Some configured instance of logging.Formatter.

Variables:

  • CLEAN (Formatter) – Format your log as follow: [INFO    1900-01-01 00:00:00]: foo.

  • XML (Formatter) – Format your log as follow: 1900-01-01T00:00:00:INFO: foo.

  • COLOR (ColorfulFormatter) – Same as CLEAN, but colored.

CLEAN = <logging.Formatter object>#
COLOR = <logtoolkit._formatters.ColorfulFormatter object>#
XML = <logging.Formatter object>#
class logtoolkit.models.Handlers#

Bases: object

Class contains configured instance of logging.handlers.*.
